report_title: Industry Report on Hobby and Toy Stores
executive_summary: Over the past five years, the Hobby and Toy Stores industry has seen a considerable shift. The rise of e-commerce has significantly altered how consumers shop, with many preferring the convenience, variety and easy access offered by online platforms. This shift has pushed traditional retailers to diversify their sales channels and increase their digital presence. The popularity of licensed toys and merchandise, inspired by popular film, television and gaming franchises, has also greatly impacted the industry, leading to robust demand and collaborations between toy companies and entertainment studios.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: E-commerce Represents an Opportunity and a Threat
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Over the last five years, the growth of e-commerce has significantly impacted the Hobby and Toy Stores industry.
The immense popularity of film, television and gaming franchises has drastically increased demand for licensed toys and merchandise.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Discount Department Stores and Mass Merchandisers Emerged as Leading Retailers
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Walmart has become the top domestic children's toy retailer.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Toys and Hobby Stores Struggled to Compete with Online Retail
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: E-commerce powerhouses like Amazon.com have lured consumers away from traditional brick-and-mortar retail stores.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The development of new and innovative toys will drive revenue growth in the Hobby and Toy Stores industry over the next five years.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Aging Baby Boomers Will Contribute to Revenue Growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As the tail end of the baby boomer generation enters retirement, many are discovering newfound leisure time.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Large Discount Retailers Will Position as Leading Toy Retailers
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Consumers will continue shopping at discount retailers and department stores because of competitive prices.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Smaller Stores Will Leverage Flexibility as Advantage
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: In the face of increasing competition from big-name retailers, hobby and toy stores will leverage their smaller size.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry sell a broad range of toy and hobby goods, like traditional dolls and toys, electronic toys, boardgames, hobby kits and craft supplies.
key_trends: Increased leisure time will support demand from older consumers over the next five years.
The industry will be aided by an uptick in the number of children aged nine and younger.

market_segmentation.segment_description: This market segment includes consumers under the age of 25.
This market segment includes consumers aged between 35 and 44.

products_and_services.product_description: This category of products contains various items that include wheeled toys, stuffed animals, dolls, toy weapons.
This segment includes hobby goods like themed collectibles, cards, puzzles and models.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Toys' Share of Industry Sales Has Fallen
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Toy and game stores have had to modify their product offerings.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Increased Leisure Time Benefits Demand for Hobby Goods
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Consumer demand for products in this segment has grown.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region boasts a high population and a large number of families with children.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchasing Costs Remain the Single Largest Expense
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The graph shows the percentage of revenue spent on different expenses by the hobby and toy store industry.
